intro: Euphrasia cisalpina, commonly known as the Alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers with prominent yellow spots. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It has hairy, upright stems and produces tiny, inconspicuous leaves. Euphrasia cisalpina is often found in meadows and open areas at high altitudes.
